column1: Blood is a liquid in humans and many animals except insects. Blood is pushed through the organism by the heart
column2: and brings nutrients and oxygen to our tissues. It also takes away waste and carbon dioxide from tissues. Blood of vertebrates is made up of blood plasma and various cells — red blood cells
column3: white blood cells and platelets. Platelets help blood to clot. Hemoglobin is in red blood cells. White blood cells help fight infections and heal wounds.Blood plasma is the yellow liquid in which blood cells float. Plasma is made up of nutrients
column9: and proteins. These proteins are albumin
column12: and protein hormones. Plasma that does not have the protein fibrinogen is called serum and cannot clot. Adults have about 3 liters of plasma. Plasma is a liquid
column13: mostly water (90%). Plasma takes up 55% of volume.
